result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven K. Bilke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED & STAYED
Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

miscConds.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.
  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim unless approved by agent.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Steven K. Bilke not in court. Account Clerk appears for Dodge County. Accout clerk heard on status of matter, Def. never set up a payment plan, $478 was due by 6/27/16, no payments have been received, request that this be turned over to the State Debt Collection and that a civil judgment be entered. Court heard, so ordered.
Pymt Hrg 12/20/16
Payment hearing on December 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Payment plan granted in the amount of $80.00 per month commencing on 5/26/16  until paid in full, with 16CM93

15CM450 & 16CM93 - Sentences are Imposed and Stayed Jail with 1 year probation

9:33 - ADA Thomspon appears for State. Defendant now appears in person w/o counsel. Court quashes WA previously authorized.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.
